title: Burnley v Chelsea betting odds: Blues’ winning streak to continue
text:
Chelsea travel to Turf Moor to face Burnley as Frank Lampard’s men look to extend their winning-streak in the Premier League

Chelsea impressing with wins

Chelsea look to be in their best form for two seasons, the 4-0 opening day defeat against Manchester United now a distant memory as the Blues go in search of their seventh consecutive win in all competitions.

On top of that, Chelsea come into the game off the back of Lampard’s most impressive win of his Chelsea managerial career.

An impressive 1-0 victory at the Johan Cruyff Arena against an Ajax side that had not lost any of their previous 17 games showed how far the team have come.

It is easy to see why Chelsea are favourites at 3/4 with Betfair.

Chelsea have won their last two matches 1-0, at home to Newcastle and away at Ajax, and are 15/2 to repeat the scoreline against Burnley.

Pulisic and Batshuayi pushing for places

Lampard appears to have found a winning formula with his selection decisions, starting with the same attacking line-up of Tammy Abraham, Mason Mount, Willian and Callum Hudson-Odoi in his last three matches.

However, Christian Pulisic and Michy Batshuayi came on against Ajax and made the difference as the former assisted the latter for the winner.

This will have given Lampard a dilemma as to who to start against Burnley.

Pulisic is 16/5 to score anytime while Batshuayi is at 7/5.

Wood hitting form at the right time

Despite having a goal controversially disallowed last weekend against Leicester, Chris Wood will be happy with his recent performances.

The New Zealand international has scored four goals in his last four appearances and is one of the most in-form strikers in the league.

Betfair have him at 15/2 to score first and 5/2 to score anytime.

Wood’s strike partner Ashley Barnes has had the opposite fortune in front of goal this season.

He has not scored in his last five outings and missed out through injury last weekend.

Burnley boss Sean Dyche expects Barnes back in the squad and Betfair have him to score anytime at 23/10.

Draw could be on the cards

Chelsea might be on a fantastic run but that has to come to an end eventually.

The win in the Netherlands on Wednesday was a draining battle for the Blues against one of the best teams in Europe.

Burnley are no pushovers and, before the Leicester defeat, were unbeaten in four games.

The Clarets have also only lost one Premier League game at home this season and this will be another testing battle for Chelsea.

Betfair have Draw and Both Teams To Score at 7/2.
description: Betting review as Chelsea travel to Turf Moor to face Burnley as Frank Lampard’s men look to extend their winning-streak in the Premier League showdown.
